meanings.sent1: She crimpled the paper into a ball and threw it in the trash.
meanings.sent2: The wind crimpled the leaves on the trees, creating a beautiful rustling sound.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy crimpled the blanket into a messy pile for fun.
meanings.sent4: His face crimpled with laughter as he watched the comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was crimpled from being folded and unfolded many times.

meanings.definition: To cause to become twisted or bent
meanings.sent1: He accidentally crimpled the straw while trying to bend it into a shape.
meanings.sent2: The heavy book crimpled the pages of the lighter book underneath it.
meanings.sent3: The magician crimpled the metal spoon with his mind-bending trick.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat crimpled the plastic cup, causing it to warp.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the snow crimpled the branches of the fragile sapling.

meanings.definition: Twisted or bent out of shape
meanings.sent1: The crimpled wire couldn't conduct electricity properly.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to open the crimpled package due to its distorted shape.
meanings.sent3: The crimpled hose made watering the garden a challenging task.
meanings.sent4: The crimpled straw in his drink made it difficult to sip.
meanings.sent5: The crimpled edge of the paper gave it a unique and artistic look.
